originalText.text: I have been training at NY Eastside Aikikai for 8 years and I can recommend this school for beginners in Aikido and for experienced practitioners. Our Sensei Ken Yamazaki and other instructors are teaching how to practice safely. In the same time classes are diverse and engaging. I find this place amazing and very supportive in my life!

Our Sensei Ken Yamazaki and other instructors are teaching how to practice safely. In the same time classes are diverse and engaging. I find this place amazing and very supportive in my life!

originalText.text: I have been training here for the past couple of months and I really enjoy  Sensei's and all the instructors' classes. The atmosphere is very clean, meditative and energetic. Also, all the members are very supportive and considerate. I highly recommend this dojo for both beginners and experts!

text.text: I have been training here for the past couple of months and I really enjoy  Sensei's and all the instructors' classes. The atmosphere is very clean, meditative and energetic. Also, all the members are very supportive and considerate. I highly recommend this dojo for both beginners and experts!

originalText.text: My overall experience at New York Eastside Aikikai has been wonderful. Excellent instructors and very supportive and positive group of people! Safe environment to train in the martial art of Aikido and also great for physical fitness as well!

text.text: My overall experience at New York Eastside Aikikai has been wonderful. Excellent instructors and very supportive and positive group of people! Safe environment to train in the martial art of Aikido and also great for physical fitness as well!

originalText.text: NY Eastside Aikikai is hands down the dojo to go to if you are looking for a place to train in Aikido.  The members are supportive and all around really cool people.  The teachers are superbly adept and accomplished.  And Yamazaki Sensei is absolutely the teacher, with his 30+ years background and commitment to this beautiful, effective martial art, who you want as your mentor.  Training here changed my life for good.  Let it change yours too.

text.text: NY Eastside Aikikai is hands down the dojo to go to if you are looking for a place to train in Aikido.  The members are supportive and all around really cool people.  The teachers are superbly adept and accomplished.  And Yamazaki Sensei is absolutely the teacher, with his 30+ years background and commitment to this beautiful, effective martial art, who you want as your mentor.  Training here changed my life for good.  Let it change yours too.

originalText.text:
I have been training in this dojo for 4 years and I can say that it is a great dojo, for all levels from first time beginners to advanced black belts, and also for children. We have a big matt with plenty of space to train. The number of students is not too large so we all know each other and everybody is happy to help in the learning. Another thing I like about this dojo is that we are careful at following the traditional Japanese etiquette.
The main instructor (Ken Yamazaki) is a Japanese 5th dan black belt that has learned Aikido for several decades from very prestigious Senseis both in Japan and in the US. At present he (and other dojo members) receives training directly from 8th dan Yamada Sensei on a weekly basis, which keeps the technical quality of the teaching at the highest level.
Aikido is a non-competitive martial art, which makes it very adequate for all ages and physical abilities.
